text: ghost opus eponymous hi everyone
Anthony Fantana here the Internet's
busiest music nerd I'm going to do an
album review on this new ghost LP opus
eponymous on my last review I asked all
of you just like I do every review what
I should review next and terrier Bram
said I should review whatever I want to
review and more than 80 of you thumbed
it up democracy all now up until the
point when I decided I was gonna review
this thing it was haunting me a little
bit just a little bit my buddy jumble
junkie showed it to me
I saw it had some good reviews on rate
your music also I was seeing it on some
blogs and most recently jgc sound
reviewed this thing also so basically
this album has kind of been like hey hey
review me hey you got nine tracks here
one of them's an intro and all the songs
just span under 35 minutes and a
critique I hear of this band often is
that they sound really retro and it's
just a gimmick it's too gimmicky the
retro sound oh it's gimmicky like modern
metal doesn't have it's gimmicks like
screaming your head off isn't a gimmick
or playing as loud as you possibly can
isn't a gimmick but the retro thing I
have to agree with to an extent a lot of
people have compared these guys to Blue
Oyster Cult but I think that's mostly
because of the sound that these guys
have kind of resembles the Erie rock
flavor of don't fear the reaper this to
me is not proto metal it's definitely
definitely metal though it does take a
bit from each traditional style of what
we listen to today from heavy to thrash
to doom long story short ghost has come
up with a really cohesive sound on this
LP that references but does not walk in
the footsteps of any one single band but
you could ask who goes back in time and
just decides they're going to resurrect
these dead sounds of rock and it's a
decent question and I feel like it could
be answered in saying metal to me has
always been a genre of
dreams and where those extremes are are
relative to when and where the music is
being put out like for example if you
take Black Sabbath's first album today
that LP as much as I love it is not
extreme however back then when it was
released that LP was pretty intense now
in its search for new extremes like
volume and heaviness and and speed metal
has lost some stuff that made it good
back in the old days like songwriting
and tune fullness melody you know all
the stuff that makes all these other
kinds of musics so good this is the kind
of stuff ghost brings back into the fold
here all that aside there are a lot of
things I love about this LP for one the
guitar the rhythm guitar just
fist-pumping riffs that get me going and
the solos are really great too they're
not too flashy they're not too up and
in-your-face they're melodic they're
catchy the drumming just gets the job
done
emphasizes the groove and really locks
in with the riffs on this entire LP some
really rhythmic bass lines that vary
from the guitars noticeably a really
sinister sinister organ playing in the
background on a lot of these tracks and
the vocals are extremely extremely clean
no screaming I would even say no
shouting and they're very on pitch I was
not enjoying the vocals that much when I
first heard this LP mostly because the
dude's voice is really really thin I
would say maybe even kind of kind of
weak it's not a powerful vocal not beefy
by any means but there are a lot of
harmonized background vocals on this LP
and when they come in on a lot of these
hooks
it sounds pretty and the last thing that
has to be brought up about this album
are the lyrics the lyrics here have a
writers obsession with Satan every song
here is either about Satan or mentioned
Satan and I know that when we listen to
music that is about or just mentioning
bezel bub the Prince of Darkness
Lucifer el Diablo we're used to hearing
the vocals like
but these like I said very clean so who
would I recommend this to if you're
Simon Belmont of the hit video game
Castlevania and you're about to enter a
manner and this manner has 1,000
vampires in it
this should be your soundtrack to slay
them I've only got one major gripe about
this LP and it's fade one of the worst
of them is on the second track of this
LP which just kind of shuts down just
when the song is getting good I'm
feeling a strong 8 to a light 9 on this
I'm really impressed with it what do you
guys think of this album go down there
in the d box find some links to listen
and yeah anthony Fantino ghost
[Music]
you
